intro: Veronica xalapensis, commonly known as the Mexican speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and prolonged blooming period.
